EditorData.stateContext: Box is out of sight in SH's inventory.

Text.Value: These Absolute forces you mentioned - what do you know about them?
No! The artefact stays with me. And I'll do whatever's necessary to protect it, if I can't make you see reason.

EditorData.NodeContext: Desperate. She needs the player to accept her.

Text.Value: There's no chances without me - only certain death, or worse.

EditorData.NodeContext: Desperate. She needs the player to accept her.

Text.Value: That artefact looks githyanki - why do you have it?
What is that thing?
You're lucky I managed to catch up with you when I did - we're both lucky, in fact.
My companion thinks this artefact is important to our people. How did you come to have it?
My companion thinks this artefact is important to her people. How did you come to have it?
I don't know what just happened, but keep away from me.
I don't know how, but this artefact is protecting me from whoever controls our parasites. You won't get much farther without it shielding you, trust me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Nods to the box in her hands on 'this artefact', then puts it away

Text.Value: If that thing's protecting you, why do you need me?
Fine - wait here. I'll fetch someone to talk to you.
Lead the way.
Looks like you're out of luck then.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Switch to different speaker slot for available avatar

Text.Value: Why do you need me so badly?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN only if SH hasn't explained why she wants to join the player.

Text.Value: You're not going anywhere with me, but I'll take that artefact.
Yes... you're someone I can deal with, I think. I felt it in your head.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: SH hands are empty (gith artefact is in her inventory)
EditorData.NodeContext: Intuitive understanding - this is the person she's been seeking

Text.Value: Changed your mind yet? I don't think either of us has the luxury of time - not against what we're facing.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This greeting if an avatar spoke to SH previously but declined to recruit her.

Text.Value: We share a common goal - getting rid of the tadpoles. Seems you've come to the same conclusion as I did, that these Absolute cultists are involved in some way. Only sensible that we help one another.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Only plays if the player concluded the forest cultist scene peacefully/heard of the absolute

Text.Value: You're infected - they'll just put you down like a rabid animal. Your best chance is with me.

EditorData.NodeContext: harsh, but with a glimmer of hope and reason at the end.

Text.Value: Hold on - who are you?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: If the player hasn't met SH yet.

Text.Value: No - either we join forces, or you don't go anywhere. Tell me where to find your camp at least.
It stays with me - I'll kill to protect it. Already have.
Why do you have this to begin with?
You need me with you. Let me speak to your leader, and we can press on.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: SH hands are empty (gith artefact is in her inventory)

Text.Value: The artefact is being hunted, and so I'm being hunted. The Absolute's forces want it. Githyanki raiders want it.
Attack.
You seem overburdened with hangers-on already.
Bring whoever leads you to speak to me. Then maybe you'll have a hope of survival.
I'll wait here, until you come to your senses. For both our sakes, I hope that happens very soon.
I'll take my chances without you. Clear off.
If my fellow githyanki want that artefact, then I should take it from you, not join you.
I don't need to deal with you - I just need the artefact. Hand it over.
Damn. We could have helped each other. So be it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Angry resignation. Instead of joining sides, she'll have to fight the player.

Text.Value: So it is you the kith'raki come for? This artefact is valuable - the knights will be relentless in their pursuit.
Very. So what do you say?
Fine - but where do I fit into this?
I'm Shadowheart - we were on the nautiloid together. We've both got the same problem... though only I might have the solution.

EditorData.NodeContext: Urgent, cutting right to the chase

Text.Value: You'd better start making a lot more sense very rapidly.
That doesn't matter - what matters is how it can help us against the monsters in our heads.

EditorData.NodeContext: Urgent, cutting right to the chase

Text.Value: I'll mark my camp on your map. You can rest there.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Switch to different speaker slot for available avatar

Text.Value: Fine, you can come with me.
Hear me out - your life depends on it. We've both got the same problem... though only I might have the solution.

EditorData.NodeContext: Urgent, cutting right to the chase

Text.Value: Attack.
We both have the same problem - the parasites. You won't make it much farther without me. I have an artefact that can protect us until we find a cure.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: SH hands are empty (gith artefact is in her inventory)
EditorData.NodeContext: Short, no-nonsense 'take me with you' pitch.

Text.Value: Fine. Just stay safe. We need each other.
How generous. What aren't you telling me?
You know, I think I'd rather take my chances without you.
You need me at your side.
Humans, goblins, and many more. It's given them a common purpose, and they're building an army in its name.
So we help each other? Sounds reasonable.
Sounds like it's that artefact I need, not you.
That voice we heard - all sorts are flocking to its banner, worshipping it as a god.
Wait. Perhaps we shouldn't. You're not the one I need to talk to, are you? Not really.

EditorData.NodeContext: realisation that she isn't talking to the person in charge.

Text.Value: Leave.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Switch to different speaker slot for available avatar

Text.Value: Make it fast. And don't even think of venturing far without me, or it'll be your last bad decision.

EditorData.stateContext: SH has Orpheus box in her hands.

Text.Value: I can't afford to get rid of it, but I can't protect it alone either. I'm lucky to have made it this far.
All right, I'll mark your map.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Switch to different speaker slot for available avatar

Text.Value: That wouldn't be wise. Even if you managed to get it off of me, do you really think your kin would welcome you with open arms?
That voice you just felt? It's because of what was done to us - the infection.

EditorData.NodeContext: Urgent, cutting right to the chase

Text.Value: I'll take the artefact, but I don't need you.
All right, come with me.
I cannot afford your presence damaging my standing with my people - leave.
I don't need you bringing wrathful githyanki down on my head - clear off.
I can feel it, in your head. You follow someone else's orders. I'll deal with them, not you.
Never mind how I got it - just be glad I have it. For now, let's just help each other. What do you say?
I've heard enough. Clear off.

Synopsis:
After Shadowheart arrives at Goblin Camp with the Orpheus box and protects the party from Voice of the Absolute, she asks to be recruited. She is desperate at this point, so either this happens or she will start combat.
NOTE: this currently only triggers at the goblin camp, but may also be needed as a fallback at the start of Act 2.
